intro: Fagonia aucheri, commonly known as the Armenian fagonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Capparaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. The plant features small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with a rough, textured surface. Fagonia aucheri is often found growing in rocky or gravelly soils, adapting well to arid and semi-arid environments.
